channel.title: Learn on Hugo Techdoc Theme
channel.description: Recent content in Learn on Hugo Techdoc Theme

item.title: Workforce Identity Cloud (WIC) Explained
item.description: Workforce Identity Cloud (WIC) Explained Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Explains WIC and compares it to the CIC domain. Describes the domain of what developer.okta.com covers. Why is this here?: - 26% of respondents could not identify Workforce Identity Cloud despite “Workforce” being in the definition. Developers new to IAM and Okta are less satisfied with the docs and visit rarely.

item.title: IAM fundamentals
item.description: Identity access management fundamentals Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Explains at a high level what is IAM. Links to original docs: This is a new doc. Bits of this doc can come from: Identity and Access Management (IAM) overview: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/iam-overview/ Why is this here?: See (ID: 1) Content type: Conceptual overview High-level explanations of the underlying concepts, architecture, or design principles behind the product or service.

item.title: MFA explained
item.description: MFA explained Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Explain the very basic concept of MFA. Also, explain the difference between a Factor and an Authenticator. Why is this here?: ‘- External Oktane 2023: 20% of respondents placed “Multi-factor Authentication” under “IAM Fundamentals”. After discussions with employees (and probably customers as well) there is a misunderstanding of what is a “Factor” and what is an Authenticator".

item.title: Understand OAuth and OpenID Connect
item.description: Understand OAuth and OpenID Connect Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: This section specifically isolates the OAuth and OpenId Connect products for Okta specific features and products. Interaction code grant type is an “extension” of Oauth and OIDC. Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Why is this here?: - At Oktane MatchIt game, 27.3% could not identify OAuth. Content type: Dynamic Index

item.title: Understand SAML
item.description: Understand SAML Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: This section organizes existing and new SAML content. Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Content type: Dynamic Index This document type is designed to automatically generate and display a list of child documents when a particular node in the navigation tree is selected. Key characteristics of this content type are: Automated Listing: Automatically generates a list of links to child documents based on the site’s structure or predefined criteria.

item.title: Understand Oktas Products
item.description: Understand Okta’s Products Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: This section gives new-to-IAM or new-to-Okta developers a high-level overview of Okta’s products to help them be successful in building solutions with Okta. Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Why is this here?: See Learn (ID: 1) Content type: Guide Hub This type of document serves as a central navigational starting point within a larger documentation system.
